definition: to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away

sentences.english: All crew members assembled on boat deck and exercised abandon ship drill.
sentences.chinese: 全體船員在艇甲板上集合，進行棄船演習。

sentences.english: I must abandon vessel after piracy in the west mouth of Malacca Strait.
sentences.chinese: 我船在馬六甲海峽西出口被海盜搶劫後必須棄船。

sentences.english: I don't want you to jump ship just yet.
sentences.chinese: 我還沒有說要你棄船逃命呢。

sentences.english: The order to abandon the ship was given and hundreds of people plunged into the icy water.
sentences.chinese: 棄船的命令發出了，數百人跳進了冰冷刺骨的海水裏。

sentences.english: After the merger many employees decided to jump ship.
sentences.chinese: 在公司合併了之後，很多員工都選擇了棄船另謀職位。

sentences.english: Mustering of the crew in response to the abandon ship alarm.
sentences.chinese: 聽到棄船信號後，在位置集結。

sentences.english: The typhoon is coming. We'll have to get everything ready to evacuate the rig.
sentences.chinese: 颱風快要來了，必須做好一切棄船準備。

sentences.english: We were sinking fast, and the captain gave the order to abandon the ship.
sentences.chinese: 我們在迅速地下沉，船長下令棄船。

sentences.english: The crew made a last ditch effort to put out the blaze before finally abandoning ship.
sentences.chinese: 在最後棄船前船員們作了撲滅大火的最後一次努力。

sentences.english: The captain of the ship has deserted.
Smee , decided to abandon the ship by jumping down into the water.
sentences.chinese: 他們和斯米先生決定棄船，跳水逃命。

sentences.english: Allcrew member assembled on the lifeboat deck, carried out abandon drill.
sentences.chinese: 全體船員在艇甲板上集合，進行棄船演習。

sentences.english: We learned from those jumbles that the captain hadn't given orders to abandon the ship.
sentences.chinese: 我們從哪些航海日誌中得知，船長並沒有下令棄船。
